shorts.title: Scranton cuts ribbon on new Weston Field pool complex
shorts.title_distilled: Scranton cuts ribbon on new Weston Field pool complex.
shorts.description: On a day when temperatures again reached 90, Scranton celebrated a major addition to its outdoor pool facilities as Mayor Paige Gebhardt Cognetti cut the ribbon at the brand-new Weston Field pool at 982 Providence Road. “The Weston Field pool offers a new swimming option for families and greater accessibility so that it can be enjoyed by more of our residents,” Cognetti said. “We’re grateful for the work with our partners and the funding that made this possible.” The project included the removal of a deteriorating structure along Providence Road and the construction of two new buildings, outdoor shower facilities, […]
shorts.content: On a day when temperatures again reached 90, Scranton celebrated a major addition to its outdoor pool facilities as Mayor Paige Gebhardt Cognetti cut the ribbon at the brand-new Weston Field pool at 982 Providence Road. “The Weston Field pool offers a new swimming option for families and greater accessibility so that it can be enjoyed by more of our residents,” Cognetti said. “We’re grateful for the work with our partners and the funding that made this possible.” The project included the removal of a deteriorating structure along Providence Road and the construction of two new buildings, outdoor shower facilities, […]
shorts.content_distilled: On a day when temperatures again reached 90, Scranton celebrated a major addition to its outdoor pool facilities as Mayor Paige Gebhardt Cognetti cut the ribbon at the brand-new Weston Field pool at 982 Providence Road.

shorts.title: Judge likely to dismiss Bob Bolus lawsuit against Commissioner Bill Gaughan
shorts.title_distilled: Judge likely to dismiss Bob Bolus lawsuit against Commissioner Bill Gaughan.
shorts.description: SCRANTON — A judge on Wednesday said he likely would dismiss Bob Bolus’ lawsuit against Lackawanna County Commissioner Bill Gaughan over the filling of a commissioner vacancy. Lackawanna County President Judge James Gibbons did not immediately issue a ruling. But at the conclusion of a hearing on oral arguments, Gibbons told Bolus that it appears he does not have the legal standing to pursue the lawsuit. “I don’t see that your petition has merit,” Gibbons told Bolus. “I don’t think you have the standing” that’s required to advance the lawsuit any further. Bolus sued Gaughan in April to bar him […]
shorts.content: SCRANTON — A judge on Wednesday said he likely would dismiss Bob Bolus’ lawsuit against Lackawanna County Commissioner Bill Gaughan over the filling of a commissioner vacancy. Lackawanna County President Judge James Gibbons did not immediately issue a ruling. But at the conclusion of a hearing on oral arguments, Gibbons told Bolus that it appears he does not have the legal standing to pursue the lawsuit. “I don’t see that your petition has merit,” Gibbons told Bolus. “I don’t think you have the standing” that’s required to advance the lawsuit any further. Bolus sued Gaughan in April to bar him […]

shorts.title: Power restored in part of Lackawanna County after weather-related outage
shorts.title_distilled: Power restored in part of Lackawanna County after weather-related outage.
shorts.description: PPL says over 300 customers were without power due to weather-related issues in the Hill Section of Scranton and a part of Dunmore on Tuesday.
shorts.content: PPL says over 300 customers were without power due to weather-related issues in the Hill Section of Scranton and a part of Dunmore on Tuesday.

shorts.title: Police K-9s beat the heat and train in the water at Harveys Lake
shorts.title_distilled: Police K-9s beat the heat and train in the water at Harveys Lake.
shorts.description: K-9 units from northeastern Pennsylvania trained in Harveys Lake, cooling off during a heat wave.
